qas.question: What part of Manhattan are the West Bronx's streets similar to?
What is the lowest street number seen in the Bronx?
What was the Bronx called in the mid-19th century?
When was the Bronx added to NYC?

context: The Bronx street grid is irregular. Like the <a0_0>northernmost part of upper Manhattan<a0_0/>, the West Bronx's hilly terrain leaves a relatively free-style street grid. Much of the West Bronx's street numbering carries over from upper Manhattan, but does not match it exactly; East <a1_0>132nd<a1_0/> Street is the lowest numbered street in the Bronx. This dates from <a3_0>the mid-19th century<a3_0/> when the southwestern area of Westchester County west of the Bronx River, was incorporated into New York City and known as <a2_0>the Northside<a2_0/>.
